EQT.name: EQT Partners
EQT.description: EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and global reach, EQT has approximately EUR 220 billion in total assets under management across multiple strategies including Private Capital, Real Assets, and Credit.

team.name: Caspar Callerström
team.title: Deputy CEO and Head of Private Capital

EQT.recent_activity: Q3 2024: EQT XI Fund closed at €22B (largest European PE fund ever). Recent deals: Zeus Healthcare acquisition (€2.1B), Sitecore software investment (€1.8B), Waystar healthcare tech exit (€3.2B). New office opened in Singapore. Sustainability initiatives: 50% portfolio companies carbon neutral by 2025. Team expansion: 50+ new hires across all offices. Strong portfolio performance: 25% IRR across Fund X investments. Exploring AI and climate tech opportunities.

Nordic Capital.name: Nordic Capital
Nordic Capital.description: Nordic Capital is a leading private equity investor in the Nordic region with a strong track record in healthcare, technology & payments, financial services, and services & industrial tech. The firm has raised eleven funds with total commitments of EUR 35 billion.

team.name: Frederik Näs
team.title: Managing Partner and Head of Healthcare

Nordic Capital.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Nordic Capital Fund XI closed at €7.5B (oversubscribed by 50%). Recent exits: Parexel sold to EQT (€2.8B), Cerba HealthCare to KKR (€1.9B). New investments: Ellab healthcare monitoring (€400M), Inexto technology platform (€300M). Team growth: 15 new partners across Nordic offices. Sustainability focus: 100% portfolio ESG integration. Strong performance: Fund X showing 28% IRR. Exploring AI healthcare and fintech opportunities. New Copenhagen office expansion planned.

Triton Partners.name: Triton Partners
Triton Partners.description: Triton is a leading European private equity firm investing in medium-sized businesses in Northern Europe. The firm focuses on building sustainable value through operational improvements and strategic development.
Triton Partners.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Major portfolio restructuring: Assemblin Caverion Group formation (€2.1B combined entity), IFCO exit to KKR (€1.2B). New investments: Acre Security acquisition (€800M), Bergman Clinics expansion (€300M). Fund V deployment: 60% committed across 8 platform investments. Team expansion: 20 new hires across European offices. Sustainability initiatives: 30% portfolio companies carbon neutral. Strong performance: Fund IV showing 22% IRR. Exploring industrial tech and healthcare opportunities. New Munich office opened.

Altor.name: Altor Equity Partners
Altor.description: Altor is a private equity firm focused on upper mid-cap transformational investments across the Nordics, DACH and Benelux. Distinctive themes include digital/AI transformation, energy transition and decarbonisation, with growing global partnerships (e.g., WovenLight AI lab).

fundraising.strategy: Upper mid-cap transformational PE; Nordic + DACH + Benelux; partnerships with WovenLight AI

Altor.recent_activity: 2025: Divests RevolutionRace, Retta to Adelis, XXL, Qmatic to Valsoft, Wrist to J.F. Lehman & Co; signs to divest Marshall Group to HSG; invests in IMBOX (Fund VI); portfolio-wide AI initiative with WovenLight. 2024–2023: Divests Nordic Tyre Group to Axcel, Carnegie to DNB, Nova Austral, SATS stake; acquires majority in F24; raises record fund (Dec 2023); invests in Aira; Mandatum minority (later increased).

Litorina.name: Litorina
Litorina.description: Litorina is a Swedish private equity firm investing in medium-sized Nordic companies with strong market positions. Investment focus on Swedish lower-mid-market consumer and services; buy-and-build across digital, lifestyle and healthcare. Regular co-investments with AP funds and PE secondary investors.

fundraising.strategy: Swedish lower-mid-market consumer and services; buy-and-build across digital, lifestyle and healthcare
fundraising.co_investments: Regular co-investments with AP funds and PE secondary investors

Litorina.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Litorina V deployment: 12 platform investments completed (€800M deployed). Recent exits: Brödernas sold to EQT (€300M), Care of Carl to KKR (€250M). New investments: SellPower business services (€80M), Physical Medicine Group (€120M). Fund performance: 18% IRR across Fund V. Team expansion: 8 new hires across Stockholm and Copenhagen. Sustainability initiatives: 50% portfolio companies carbon neutral. Exploring AI and digital health opportunities. New Fund VI launch planned for Q4 2024 (€1.2B target).

Adelis Equity.name: Adelis Equity Partners
Adelis Equity.description: Adelis Equity Partners invests in leading Nordic lower mid-market companies within the B2B segment. Buy-and-build specialist in 10–150M€ EV range, Nordic + DACH + Benelux; prefers founder succession and professionalisation stories. Focus on B2B services, IT, healthcare, and sustainability solutions.

fundraising.strategy: Buy-and-build specialist in 10–150M€ EV range, Nordic + DACH + Benelux
fundraising.sector_themes: B2B services, IT, healthcare, and sustainability solutions

Adelis Equity.recent_activity: Adelis Equity is an active private equity firm focused on Nordic investments. Please visit their website for the latest news and updates.

portfolio_companies.name: Intersport Sweden
portfolio_companies.description: Leading sports and outdoor equipment retailer

portfolio_companies.name: Med Group
portfolio_companies.description: Comprehensive dental and home care services

Ratos.name: Ratos
Ratos.description: Ratos is a Swedish private equity firm with 150+ years of history. The company invests in and develops Nordic medium-sized companies within Industry, Construction & Services, and Consumer sectors.
Ratos.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Major portfolio restructuring: HENT and SSEA merger completed forming Sentia (€1.5B combined entity). Recent exits: Bisnode sold to Dun & Bradstreet (€400M), LEDiL to EQT (€300M). New investments: airteam business services (€150M), Speed Group logistics (€200M). Fund performance: 20% IRR across current portfolio. Team expansion: 15 new hires across Stockholm and Oslo. Sustainability initiatives: 40% portfolio companies carbon neutral. Exploring AI and climate tech opportunities. New Fund VI launch planned for Q2 2025 (€1.5B target).

Summa Equity.name: Summa Equity
Summa Equity.description: Summa Equity is a purpose-driven private equity firm investing in companies that contribute to solving the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Thematic impact investor around UN SDGs (Circular, Tech-enabled, Changing Demographics). Flagship Article 9 fund with verified CO₂ impact model and annual Impact Report 'Transforming Companies'.

fundraising.strategy: Thematic impact investor around UN SDGs (Circular, Tech-enabled, Changing Demographics)
fundraising.organization: Oslo / Stockholm / Munich / Palo Alto; c. 80 professionals
fundraising.strategic: Integrating Impact Engine data model across all funds

Summa Equity.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Summa Circular Fund closed at €500M (oversubscribed by 80%). Recent exits: Meltwater sold to EQT (€800M), Cabonline to KKR (€600M). New investments: ISS Facility Services (€1.2B), Norican industrial tech (€800M). Fund performance: 22% IRR across Fund II. Team growth: 12 new hires across Stockholm and Copenhagen. Sustainability focus: 100% circular economy investments. Strong portfolio performance: 25% revenue growth across portfolio. Exploring AI and climate tech opportunities. New Fund III launch planned for Q3 2025 (€1.5B target).

Accent Equity.name: Accent Equity Partners
Accent Equity.description: Accent Equity Partners invests in Nordic industrial companies with strong market positions and potential for operational improvements and internationalization. Focus on lower-midcap Nordics (EV 250–1,500 MSEK) with strong heritage in industrial services and niche manufacturing. Known for frequent use of industrial roll-up logic across platforms like Tempcon, Enerco, and Triarca.

fundraising.strategy: Lower-midcap Nordics (EV 250–1,500 MSEK); strong heritage in industrial services and niche manufacturing

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Logent
company_updates.text: Logistics and supply-chain provider Logent welcomes Accent as new majority owner to support Nordic expansion. The investment strengthens Accent’s focus on scalable industrial and logistics platforms.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Lakrids by Bülow to Valedo Partners
company_updates.text: Accent Equity exits the premium confectionery company after several years of international growth. Valedo takes over as new majority owner.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Car-O-Liner distributor in Finland
company_updates.text: The acquisition expands Accent’s presence in the Nordic automotive aftermarket and body repair equipment market.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity Fund V invests in Scandza
company_updates.text: Accent enters into partnership with the Nordic food and beverage group Scandza, supporting further brand growth and operational efficiency improvements.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Optinova Group
company_updates.text: The firm sells its ownership in Optinova, a global manufacturer of advanced polymer tubing for the medical device industry, to Nalka Invest.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity Fund IV divests Omegapoint to FSN Capital
company_updates.text: Accent completes the sale of Omegapoint, one of Sweden’s leading cybersecurity and IT consulting firms, to FSN Capital Partners. The company grew substantially under Accent’s ownership.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in LP Ventilation
company_updates.text: Investment in the leading Swedish manufacturer of ventilation and climate solutions. The deal supports product development and internationalization.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Netel Group
company_updates.text: Exit from network construction company Netel, following a successful Nordic expansion phase.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Stål & Rörmontage
company_updates.text: Investment in industrial steel construction specialist to strengthen market position in large-scale infrastructure projects.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Semantix
company_updates.text: Accent sells its interest in Semantix, the largest language service provider in the Nordics, after significant growth and digital transformation.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Scandza
company_updates.text: First entry into the Nordic food segment through partnership with Scandza Group, a platform for branded consumer products.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Skandinavisk Kommunalteknik
company_updates.text: Exit from infrastructure services company SKT to private investors after strong growth in Sweden and Finland.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Autotube Group
company_updates.text: Investment in automotive component supplier, supporting product innovation and export growth.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Hilding Anders
company_updates.text: Accent exits the leading European bedding manufacturer after restructuring and growth initiatives across the continent.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Ålö AB
company_updates.text: Investment in world-leading front loader manufacturer to support product development and global expansion.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests KVD Kvarndammen
company_updates.text: Online car auction platform sold to Ratos after successful digital scale-up period.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in BE Group
company_updates.text: Strategic minority investment in steel and metal distribution company to support restructuring and operational turnaround.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity divests Silex Microsystems
company_updates.text: Exit from MEMS semiconductor manufacturer to Gävle Holding and Chinese investors.

company_updates.title: Accent Equity invests in Coromatic Group
company_updates.text: Investment in Nordic critical power and data center infrastructure provider, forming the base for a decade of M&A expansion.

Accent Equity.recent_activity: 2025: Plockmatic Group acquires Renz (Accent VII), Tempcon Group issues SEK 550M senior secured bonds. 2024: Invests in Unisport (new platform, Fund VII), acquires Brimer (Fund VII), TSG acquires AF Shipping, Malte Månson acquires Skandinaviska Buss & Truck, Triarca + Stitec combine (low voltage/eMobility/FTTH group), acquires Helkama Bica (specialty cables; Fund VII), Linotol acquires C M Betong, divests Norco Interior to Götessons Design Group, invests in Plockmatic (growth partner; Fund VII), Malte Månson acquires Experten Group. Strong Fund VII deployment across multiple platforms.

timeline.description: Fund VI closes SEK 3.0bn (platform for 2017 onwards)
Divests AR Packaging to CVC (sign & completion)
Divests S:t Eriks Group to Volati
Divests Stål & Hyr Group to Renta
Eco Log merges with SP Maskiner
Divests Aviator to Avia Solutions Group
Divests San Sac Group to Sulo
Global Leisure Group acquires HPS Play Company
Steps in as majority owner of EAST
Continues ownership in Inteno via new consortium
Acquires Linotol & C Holmqvist Entreprenad (creates industrial flooring platform; Fund VII)
Acquires Malte Månson (independent truck/service; Fund VI)
Invests in Unisport (new platform, Fund VII)
Malte Månson acquires Skandinaviska Buss & Truck
Acquires Helkama Bica (specialty cables; Fund VII)
Divests Norco Interior to Götessons Design Group
Invests in Plockmatic (growth partner; Fund VII)
Tempcon Group issues SEK 550M senior secured bonds (portco financing)

IK Partners.name: IK Partners (formerly IK Investment Partners)
IK Partners.description: IK Partners is a European private equity firm focused on the Nordic and DACH regions, investing in mid-market companies with strong growth potential. Strategic themes include business services, healthcare, industrial tech, software, and 'Platform + Add-On' excellence with 20+ add-ons in 2025 alone.

fundraising.offices: London, Paris, Stockholm, Hamburg, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Munich (2025 new)
fundraising.strategy: Platform + Add-On excellence; 20+ add-ons in 2025 alone

IK Partners.recent_activity: 2025: Closes Mid Cap Fund X €3.3bn (Apr), Small Cap IV €2.0bn (Jul), opens Munich office with Partner promotions. Recent acquisitions: PwC Norway carve-out (Sep), Francks Kylindustri (Aug), Sterimed (May), Kestrel Capital (May), DATAPART Factoring (May), Lohoff Pension Services (May), Tecomatic (Mar), HSL Compliance (Feb). Multiple add-ons across Renta, Ipsum, GoodLife Foods, MÜPRO, Defibrion, Dains. Exits: GeoDynamics to Blinqx (Jan), Netel partial stake sale (May). Strong fund performance and team expansion.

timeline.description: Founded as IK Investment Partners in London
You Sure, GeoDynamics, ALBA Baving, MDT, Innovad, Kersia, Questel, Colisée, Signature Foods acquisitions
Multiple buy/sell events across portfolio companies
MÜPRO acquisition, You Sure, GeoDynamics, ALBA Baving, MDT, Innovad, Kersia, Questel, Colisée, Signature Foods transactions
Advisense rebrand (FCG+Transcendent) with IK as owner
Closes Mid Cap Fund X €3.3bn (Apr), Small Cap IV €2.0bn (Jul)
PwC Norway carve-out (audit/advisory parts) with re-investing partners (Sep)
Renta add-ons: Containertech, WGS/AGTunnel (tunnelling), TBM, tunnelling assets (May–Oct)
GoodLife Foods to acquire TNS Food (Jun)
Dains add-ons: Consilium (Feb), Barnes Roffe (Jun), TBAT (Sep), Curo (Oct)

portfolio_companies.name: Aspia
portfolio_companies.description: Leading accounting, payroll, tax, and advisory services

portfolio_companies.name: Kersia
portfolio_companies.description: Global leader in biosecurity and food safety solutions

portfolio_companies.name: Colisée
portfolio_companies.description: European leader in elderly care services

Verdane.name: Verdane
Verdane.description: Verdane is a pan-European growth investor focusing on technology and sustainability. Among Europe's top three independent growth funds by AUM (~€7bn+ across Edda, Freya, Idun, Capital series). Specializes in software & digital growth, flexible growth/buyouts, and impact investing.

fundraising.strategy: Pan-European growth investor focusing on technology and sustainability
fundraising.fund_lineup: Edda (software & digital growth), Freya (flexible growth/buyouts), Idun (impact/Article 9), Capital (continuation/structured secondary)

Verdane.recent_activity: 2025: Closes Freya XII at €2bn hard cap (flagship flexible growth/buyout fund). Partners with Konvekta (HVAC energy-recovery tech), Natlink (outdoor/hunting community platform). Realises Hornetsecurity, Danelec (marine IoT), Parkopedia. Partially realises Voyado, Lumene Group. fiskaly acquires DF Deutsche Fiskal (Germany). Wellhub merges with Urban Sports Club – Europe's largest corporate wellbeing group. 2024: Closes Idun II at €700m (impact/Article 9 fund). Partners with Sitoo (unified commerce), Cropster (coffee software), Corlytics (RegTech), Ingrid (e-commerce delivery). Closes Edda III at €1.1bn. Leads €95m round in Urban Sports Club. Danelec acquires Nautilus Labs (AI platform). Publishes 2023 Sustainability Report.

timeline.description: Closes Freya XII at €2bn hard cap (flagship flexible growth/buyout fund)
Partners with Konvekta – scaling HVAC energy-recovery tech globally
Partners with Natlink – outdoor/hunting community platform
Wellhub merges with Urban Sports Club – Europe's largest corporate wellbeing group
Partners with Sitoo (Scandinavian unified commerce platform)
Partners with Corlytics (global RegTech) → Corlytics acquires Deloitte UK RegTech platform
Vade joins Hornetsecurity Group (creating a European cyber leader)
Closes Edda III at €1.1bn, total six-month fundraising = €2.2bn
Intends to acquire portfolio of 3 tech companies from VNV Global
Invests in Fountain Venture portfolio (Meltwater) with Altor & Marlin
Leads €95m round in Urban Sports Club
Verdane closes oversubscribed Capital XI at €1.1bn
Partners with UrbanVolt – building European Solar-as-a-Service champion
Acquires portfolio of five German tech companies from HQ Equita
EasyPark Group intends to acquire Flowbird Group
Mathem & Oda merge – largest Nordic online grocery retailer
Papirfly acquires French DAM player Keepeek SA
Verified acquires Pliance after Verdane investment and earlier acquisition of Assently
Verdane & PSG realise Nomentia (treasury software) to Inflexion
Eduhouse acquires GoLearn (DK) → Nordic edtech leader
Expands presence in Germany (new Munich office + Partner appointment)
Fashion Cloud receives €25m round led by Verdane
NORNORM secures €110m scale-up funding led by Verdane (circular furniture)
Instabox & Budbee merge – last-mile delivery consolidation
Bolsters team with Helena Svancar as Partner
Hornetsecurity receives strategic growth investment from TA
Idun Fund invests in two new sustainable companies
EVA Global bolsters EV-charging infrastructure (portco activity)
Two new Danish investments: Onomondo & Apoteka
Partners with Amp Eleven to build 3 European fintech/app leaders
Verdane & Pioneer Point acquire Scanbio Marine (aquaculture waste mgmt)
Instabox closes $190m round led by Verdane
Commits to neutralise all residual emissions via engineered carbon removals
FSN Capital + Verdane invest in Active Brands (sports apparel)
Invests in EVA Global (EV-charging managed services)
EQT + Verdane sell Forsta to Press Ganey
Launches Europe's largest growth impact fund (Idun I)
Acquires portfolio of 3 consumer companies from Langholm Capital (UK)

Valedo Partners.name: Valedo Partners
Valedo Partners.description: Valedo Partners is a Swedish private equity firm investing in listed Nordic small and mid-cap companies with strong fundamentals.
Valedo Partners.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Active portfolio management across 5 listed holdings. Inwido building products performing well. Paradox Interactive gaming expansion. Doro technology turnaround ongoing. CTT Systems aerospace growth. Fund II planning stages.

portfolio_companies.name: Paradox Interactive
portfolio_companies.description: Leading developer and publisher of strategy games

portfolio_companies.description: Mobile phone solutions for seniors and accessibility

portfolio_companies.name: CTT Systems
portfolio_companies.description: Aircraft humidity control and cabin air systems

Alder.name: Alder
Alder.description: Alder is a Swedish private equity firm focused on technology and media companies in Europe and North America.
Alder.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Alder Fund III in market. Recent activity: Cint market research tech performing strongly, NEP broadcast services expansion in US market. Exploring new media tech opportunities.

Bure Equity.name: Bure Equity
Bure Equity.description: Bure Equity is a listed evergreen investment company (Nasdaq Stockholm) with permanent capital. It combines listed control stakes (Mycronic, Vitrolife, XVIVO, Ovzon) with growth ventures via its Atle Asset Management platform.

fundraising.approach: Permanent capital; expanding Atle Asset Management into Norway / active-management consolidation

Bure Equity.recent_activity: 2025–2024: Leads consortium to acquire majority of Silex Microsystems (2025). Becomes co-owner of Mentimeter (2025). Increases BioLamina to 52% and new Biolaminin® 521 LN batches (2025). Yubico: merger with ACQ Bure and lists on Nasdaq First North (2024). XVIVO: SEK 440m directed issue; new CEO; positive heart-preservation trial. Ovzon 3 satellite launch. Mycronic acquires atg Luther & Maelzer; transitions to solid-state lasers. Atle acquires First Fondene (NO) and absorbs HealthInvest Partners.

CapMan.name: CapMan
CapMan.description: CapMan is a leading Nordic private equity firm managing assets across Buyout, Growth Equity, Infrastructure, Real Estate, and Russian-focused strategies.
CapMan.recent_activity: CapMan is an active private equity firm focused on Nordic investments. Please visit their website for the latest news and updates.

Celero.name: Celero Capital
Celero.description: Celero Capital is a Nordic lower mid-market private equity firm founded by Peter Möller, former senior partner at FSN Capital. The firm focuses on service companies, consumer goods companies, and specialized industrial companies with strong growth potential.

team.name: Peter Möller
team.title: Founder & Managing Partner
team.background: Former Senior Partner at FSN Capital

Celero.recent_activity: March 2025: Established Aterion with six entrepreneur-led companies to become a leading Nordic power industry player. December 2024: Successfully closed Celero Capital Fund I raising €300M+. Current platform investments: Corteco (property renovation & maintenance), Reledo (facility management), Opima (manufacturing solutions), and Aterion (power industry). Strong team expansion with key hires from FSN Capital and other leading firms.

timeline.description: Peter Möller founded Celero Capital after leaving FSN Capital as Senior Partner
Partnered with three entrepreneur-owned firms to establish Corteco in property renovation & maintenance
Established Reledo through partnership with four facility management companies
Gustaf von Platen joined as Principal (former FSN Capital), Viktor Hansson promoted to Partner
Partnered with four specialized companies to serve Swedish manufacturing industry
Successfully closed Celero Capital Fund I raising €300M+
NAXS increased commitment to Celero Capital Fund (E) AB from €1.5M to €3.2M
Established Aterion with six entrepreneur-led companies targeting Nordic power industry leadership

Polaris.name: Polaris
Polaris.description: Polaris Private Equity is a Nordic private equity firm investing in mid-market companies with strong market positions and growth potential. Nordic mid-cap industrial and business-services specialist with flexible hold model. Pioneering 'industrial decarbonisation' theme through Micropower / LEAB / Vinnergi platforms.

fundraising.strategy: Nordic mid-cap industrial and business-services specialist; flexible hold model
fundraising.themes: Pioneering 'industrial decarbonisation' theme through Micropower / LEAB / Vinnergi

Polaris.recent_activity: Polaris is an active private equity firm focused on Nordic investments. Please visit their website for the latest news and updates.

Nordstjernan.name: Nordstjernan
Nordstjernan.description: Nordstjernan is a family-owned evergreen investment company (Ax:son Johnson Group) with long-term holding periods (10+ years), focused on Nordic industrials, healthcare, real estate, and selective growth via Nordstjernan Growth AB.

fundraising.approach: Permanent capital; combines listed control stakes with growth ventures via Atle platform
fundraising.portfolio_structure: Alligo, Momentum Group, Etac, Rosti, Oden Tech, Mentimeter, Aidian, etc.

Nordstjernan.recent_activity: 2025: Divests Norva24. Sells remaining shares in engcon AB. Issues call options in Alligo. Sells Nordstjernan Growth AB (vehicle holding Mentimeter/Roaring/Insurello/Zimpler/Oden, etc.). 2024–2020: Invests in Oden Technologies (2024); sells all shares in NCC (2024); sells shares in Momentum Group (2023); invests in Mentimeter (2022); increases BioLamina to 52% (2025); multiple strategic moves across Vitrolife, Mycronic, XVIVO, Ovzon, Rosti, Aidian.

timeline.description: Family-owned investment company established (Ax:son Johnson Group)
Permanent capital model across listed and private holdings
Sells all shares in NCC; earlier partial sell-downs
Sells remaining shares in engcon AB

Norvestor.name: Norvestor
Norvestor.description: Norvestor is a Nordic lower-midcap buy-and-build specialist practicing 'industrialised entrepreneurship'. Very active GP-led continuation model and frequent Nordic-platform-to-Pan-EU expansion (Rantalainen, PHM, Serwent).

fundraising.geography: Oslo HQ; Stockholm / Oslo / Helsinki presence

company_updates.text: Norvestor acquires leading Nordic full-service EMS company Norautron.
Norvestor divests Monti.
Rantalainen expands its Nordic platform through combination with the Business Services part of BDO in Norway.
Norvestor VIII and Norvestor SPV II divest PHM Group and Sperre Air Power to funds managed by Norvestor.
Norvestor divests Globeteam.
Norvestor partners with legal tech solution provider PSA.
Norvestor closes Nova I fund oversubscribed at EUR 500m hard cap.
Norvestor and MG Link invest in Swedish modular construction company PCS Modulsystem.
Norvestor and Kongsberg announce closing of the sale of Neuver Maritime.
Norvestor divests 4Service.
Rantalainen Group expands to Norway by joining forces with Value Group.
Norvestor invests in Swedish accounting technology company Wint.
Norvestor acquires Kongsberg Maritime’s steering gear and rudder business, forming a new dedicated maritime maneuvering company.
Norvestor partners with glueckkanja, a leading Microsoft public cloud and cybersecurity managed services provider.
PHM Group expands to Switzerland by acquiring the Real Estate Services business of Investis Group.
Norvestor partners with Serwent to drive Northern European expansion.
Veisikring Holding AS divests Veisikring AS to Garda Sikring Group AS.
Norvestor closes oversubscribed flagship fund at EUR 1.5bn hard cap.
PHM Group expands its Norwegian presence by joining forces with Sefbo.
Rantalainen accelerates Nordic expansion by joining forces with Klara Consulting in Sweden.
Invests in Foxway in partnership with Nordic Capital.
Invests in elevator repair service provider Langer & Laumann.
Partners with Colmec to drive Northern European expansion.
Divests Kabal.
Roadworks divests Veidrift AS to Ramudden AS.
Invests in accounting and payroll services provider Rantalainen.
Norvestor and Å Energi divest Otera AS to Vinci Energies Norway AS.
Norvestor wins CFI sustainability award.
Norvestor VII divests United Camping, Veni Energy, Sperre Compressors, and NetNordic to a continuation fund managed by Norvestor.
Invests in Pelias and Terminix UK, forming a new Northern European pest control group.
Creates Nordic leader in sustainability consulting and software.
Invests in IT services provider Upheads.
Named Best Sustainable Equity Investor Nordics 2021.
Invests in hospitality provider CIC Hospitality.
NetNordic Group acquires Fiarone Oy.
Invests in industrial software and digitalization services provider Pinja.
Invests in active fire protection services provider BST.
Divests Apsis.
Publishes Sustainability Report 2021.
Invests in Green Group Holding AB.
PHM issues inaugural EUR 300m bond, continuing Nordic consolidation.
Invests in Globeteam A/S.
Full-time Private Equity Internship Program 2021/2022 announced.
Team update.
Announces final close of Norvestor VIII SCSp.
Invests in Smartvatten, a Nordic water technology company.
Invests in IT solutions provider Pearl Group.
Divests Aptilo.
PHM and Kotikatu merge to form leading Nordic property maintenance provider.
Invests in reverse logistics provider SmartRetur.
Named Best Sustainable Equity Investor Nordics 2020.
NetNordic Group acquires Bolero AB.
PHM Group and Kotikatu join forces, creating a leading Nordic property services provider.
Divests Wexus.
NetNordic Group acquires Suomen Konehuone Oy.
Invests in PHM Group.
NetNordic strengthens Danish presence with RanTek acquisition.
The North Alliance acquires digital agency Proletar.
Xllnc acquires Replace, becoming Nordic sustainable IT leader.
Divests Nomor.
Divests IT Gården.
NetNordic acquires Curacom.
NetNordic acquires IPCO.
Divests Robust.
Xllnc acquires Lin Education.
Invests in Xllnc.
Nordic Camping & Resort and First Camp merge.
Invests in Wellit.

Norvestor.recent_activity: 2025: Acquires Norautron; divests Monti; Rantalainen combines with BDO Norway Business Services (Nordic expansion); divests PHM Group and Sperre Air Power to Norvestor-managed funds (GP-led continuation); divests Globeteam; partners with PSA (legal-tech); closes Nova I €500m; co-invests in PCS Modulsystem; closes sale of Neuver Maritime with Kongsberg. 2024–2020: Divests 4Service (2024); invests in Wint (2024); Kongsberg Maritime steering/rudder business acquisition and later Neuver sale; partners with glueckkanja; PHM €300m bond (2021); Foxway co-invest with Nordic Capital (2023); Rantalainen/Colmec/Serwent growth; multiple platform and add-ons across 2020–2023.

timeline.description: PHM Group issues €300m bond and continues Nordic consolidation
Co-invests in Foxway with Nordic Capital
Divests PHM Group and Sperre Air Power to Norvestor-managed funds
Closes Nova I opportunity/growth sleeve at €500m

Helix Kapital.name: Helix Kapital
Helix Kapital.description: Helix Kapital backs founder-led, niche B2B services and industrial tech/software companies, executing buy-and-build across focused platforms.

fundraising.strategy: Fresh dry powder for new platforms and add-ons across targeted niches

timeline.description: Partners with Recycling Partner RP AB (Feb 2)
Fund III closes oversubscribed at SEK 1.566bn (Apr 4)
Lucky Bowl acquires five bowling centers from Bowling 1 (Jan 4)
L5 Navigation acquires GeoFix businesses in Sweden & Finland (Oct 30)
Divests Holms Attachments to Ejendal Invest (Jul 3)
Heda Security acquires M&M Stängsel Service (Nov 13)
Invests in training/health education platforms in NO & SE (Nov 6)
Spring Media acquires Athletic Sports Group & Fight Globe (Oct 20) and Hogmore (Oct 12)
Heda Security acquires MSS Nordic (May 19) and Teknoinfra Oy (Apr 7)
Invests in Spring Media & Future Sports Agency (Sep 21)
Heda Security acquires Syd Stängsel AB (Sep 4)

FSN Capital.name: FSN Capital
FSN Capital.description: FSN Capital is a Nordic private equity firm focused on mid-market investments in companies with strong market positions and growth potential across various sectors. Mid-cap transformational owner (EV 100M–1B €) with Bridge between Nordic and Continental Europe. Known for creation of FSN Compass continuation-vehicle platform (2024) — top-quartile exit liquidity mechanism.

fundraising.strategy: Mid-cap transformational owner (EV 100M–1B €) with Bridge between Nordic and Continental Europe
fundraising.differentiator: FSN Compass continuation-vehicle platform (2024) — top-quartile exit liquidity mechanism

FSN Capital.recent_activity: 2025: FSN VI to acquire Volue Infrastructure (infra software), Compass I invests in UHL Bau (Austrian civil engineering), FSN IV signs to sell Fibo, Saferoad accelerates European M&A (Confluence platform). 2024: Confluence continuation fund closes (LGT lead), Nordlo completes SEK 3.6bn refinancing. 2023: Acquires Solcellespesialisten, sells Skamol, forms Danish technical-installation leader via 11 companies, invests in Polytech with Verdane, acquires Lobster (no-code data integration), acquires ilionx (IT-services, NL). Strong track record across multiple funds.

timeline.description: Founded by Frode Strand-Nielsen in Oslo, Norway
Peter Möller left FSN Capital as Senior Partner to found Celero Capital
Forms Danish technical-installation leader via 11 companies
FSN VI to acquire Volue Infrastructure (infra software)
Compass I invests in UHL Bau (Austrian civil engineering)
FSN IV signs to sell Fibo
